Hello !
I am new here, and I try to describe my problem.
I'm interested i=
n using Cantera to calculate gas equilbrium 
composition. I am planning to =
write program in C++ which, among 
others, will be calculating gas composit=
ion in equlibrium state. All 
I need is a function which input data are tem=
perature and gas 
composition, and output data is composition in equlibrium=
 state. I 
found here 
http://sourceforge.net/project/showfiles.php?group_i=
d=3D78833 in 
Cantera workshop section in introduction.pdf file that it is =
possible 
(or at least I think so, but I might be wrong). At page 23 of thi=
s 
pdf file is a code that looks like it is a way to solve my problem:

#in=
clude "Cantera.h"
#include "GRI30.h"
#include "equilibrium.h"

//using name=
space std;
int main()
{
	GRI30 gas;
	gas.setState_TPX(300.0, OneAtm, "CH4:1=
,O2:2,N2:7.52");
	equilibrate(gas, "HP");
	cout << gas;

	return 0;
}

How =
to do it to have such function in C++? I followed the 
instructions that ar=
e in pdf files in section Building and installing 
(cantera153-build-win32.=
pdf and cantera154-build.pdf) but I met some 
difficulties. If anyone could=
 help me, I'd be very grateful. If 
someone someone takes on to do it, I wi=
ll write precisely where I 
found difficulties.

I have Visual C++ 6.0 Intr=
oductionary Edition (I also have ver 5.0 
Professional Edition but trying t=
o use it, difficulties appeared 
earlier, I couldn't do 'build all'), I don=
't have MATLAB (and I'm not 
going to have) and I'm interesting in writting=
 program in Vicual C++ 
(not in Python) and my computer knowledge is quite =
poor (I just can 
writte programs in C++ or Fortran).

Regards,
Rafa=B3
